text.__SUMMARY__: Rhododendron annae (桃叶杜鹃) is a rhododendron species native to central and western Guizhou and western Yunnan, China, where it grows at altitudes of 1200–3000 meters. It is a shrub that grows to 1.5–2 m in height, with leathery leaves that are narrow elongate-lanceolate to oblong-elliptic, 7–10 by 2–3.7 cm in size. Flowers are predominantly white.
text.References:
"Rhododendron annae", Franchet, J. Bot. (Morot). 12: 258. 1898.
